name: SpringHill Suites Las Vegas Convention Center

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We went to Las Vegas for a wedding. Liked that there was not a casino or slot machines at this hotel. Liked the modern look of the rooms. Although not on the main strip easy to get to either walking, driving or taking the monorail.
reviews.title: Quiet and calm

reviews.text: I was attending a convention at the Las Vegas Hilton which this hotel is across the street from. It's fairly new, and has many of the amenities of a large hotel. The lobby is large, roomy, with many places to sit and relax. There ia a lounge where you can order a drink and snacks. The sweet potato fries are delicious and for the price you get a large basket with dipping sauce. There is a small area set aside for two computers and one reserved only for printing airline boarding passes, a wonderful convenience. If you have forgotten something, there is a place to buy personal items as well as snacks and drinks, nice since the rooms have both refrigerators and microwaves, as well as a one cup coffee maker. On my first night, as I had just finished my shower, the power went out in my room. Katie, the front desk woman, ably took care of the problem, promptly finding me a new room, and even helping me take my baggage to it. The rooms are nice, with comfortable beds, 5 pillows, a flat screen TV that swivels between the bed area or the sitting area that has a couch/sofabed. There's also a desk with Net connection. The bathroom is especially nice, with the shower/sink in one room and a toilet/sink in another. The shower is quite large with separate lighting.There's a pool and viewing deck on the 24th floor, with views of Vegas all around. The exercise room has nice equipment and was being used by customers much of the time. The best thing about this hotel that helps budgets is the morning buffet breakfast. This is no continental breakfast most hotels have. We had pastries, bagels and toast with the necessary toppings, 6 different kinds of cereal for both the kids and adults, hot oatmeal, yogurts, scrambed eggs, meats (we had turkey and pork sausage and canadian bacon), and 2 waffle makers. Coffee, milk and juices round out the choices. For a family, think of what you can save on one meal a day! I have one complaint, but this is due more to my technical ineptitude so be forewarned. The usual clock/radio has been replaced by an ipod docking port. I couldn't set the alarm no matter how many times I read the instructions. So I tended to wake up frequently during the night.
reviews.title: Not perfect but darn close!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: But if you're in the need of good clean housing while in Vegas, check out this hotel. It's practically perfect in every way.
reviews.title: Excellent Off Strip Hotel With Above and Beyond Service!

reviews.text: We had made reservations at another hotel on the for Sunday through Tuesday, but decided we would head to Vegas a day early. Being a Saturday night we knew the rates would be higher anywhere on the strip so we chose to book at the Marriott Springhill because it wasn't too hard on the budget. For a one night stay this hotel was AWESOME!
reviews.title: Great new location - friendly staff, comfortable and stylish facilities.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived and were surprised to see how close we actually were to the strip (only about a mile maybe 2 mile walk and you are at Encore/Wynn). And if walking is not your thing, cross the street and you can hop right on the monorail and for a small fee you are right on the strip.
reviews.title: Great room- road work at night

reviews.text: We recently spent two nights at this new hotel. Others have correctly reviewed it. When we couldn't figure out the air conditioner, someone immediately came up to show us. Very nice, helpful stafff. The pool was small, but quiet and nice. We would definitely stay here again if we weren't seeking the action of the Strip.
reviews.title: An excellent non-gaming choice

reviews.text: First visit back to Vegas in a little over 3 years and stayed at this hotel after reading all the good views. It was also my first time staying in a non-gaming hotel in Vegas, so I did not have to experience the loud blaring of slot machines. The room itself was larger than most hotels that I stayed in and had room for my family (2 queen beds and 1 sofa bed). The room also had free high speed internet though I found it to be very slow and somewhat sporadic; even with the Ethernet cable that was provided. Aside from the internet issue; the free breakfast had quite a variety and the do-it-yourself waffles were delicious. Staff were friendly and attentive and even allowed my family a late checkout, lasting one hour, without additional fees.
reviews.title: First time at a non-gaming hotel but won't be the last

reviews.text: The only non-hotel issue was the location itself. The hotel was located about half a mile from the strip; where most of the hotels were located. However, gaming was not far away as one could go to either Riviera or Las Vegas Hilton to gamble.
reviews.title: Would stay here again without any questions

reviews.text: I would recommend staying at this hotel if you just want a quiet place to stay without the casino. I know that this would be my first choice when I return to Vegas and would like to stay at a non-gaming hotel.
reviews.title: Great Hotel with a Few Issues

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed here for two nights with my husband and 13 month old son while we were on a very last minute road trip. I made the reservations two days before we arrived and was told to call the morning of to see if we would be able to check in early.
reviews.title: Excellent off strip property next to convention center
Las Vegas stay
reviews.text: Hotel had just opened, so the facility and staff was going through growing pains. Even with that, the facility is outstanding. The staff went out of their way to see that our meeting needs were met. Great location to both the old and new stripes.
What I like the most, besides smoking-free, is the cleanliness!!! So impressive!
reviews.title: Clean, comfortable, and relaxing place to stay

reviews.text: I had the pleasure of staying at the hotel April 21st through April 25th. Everything was exceptional. From the time that I entered the lobby to the time I checked out, the service was first class! The room was very clean. There was a mini refrig and microwave in the room. This was a business and leisure trip combined. I would highly recommend this hotel to individuals who want to be able to sleep while in Las Vegas! It is located directly across the street from the Las Vegas Hilton so if gambling is your thing, it is readily available! No taxi needed.
reviews.title: Great hotel! Great price! Quiet place to sleep while in Las Vegas!

reviews.text: what a hotel!!! totally beautiful springhill suites with a huge parking garage and free deluxe breakfast. 10 minute walk through the riveria casino to the strip. no need to take the tram since it was a close walk for me. first time on the strip and acutally played blackjack for 5 hours and even made $200. would definately recommend and would stay here again.
reviews.title: outstanding stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I just returned from a stay at the Spring Hill Suites. The building just recently opened, is well appointed, room are spacious with separate sleeping area and sitting area, separate bathroom/shower and toilet. Room are well furnished, modern and very comfortable (as in all Marriotts, their beds are great) Staff and check in were very uneventfull and very friendly. There is a small heated pool in the roofdeck, as well as a fire pit. Breakfast is included with the room rates and, unlike some reports of other travellers, it was always stocked and replenished - everything from eggs, wafles, fresh fruite, bagels, pastries, juices, yoghurt, etc - an excellent breakfast buffet. Breakfast is served in the very spacious and airy lobby. We had a rental car - there is a parking garage on the lower floors of the building (parking is free). Drive from the hotel to the Strip is a few minutes (parking at hotels on the Strip such as Bellagio, Venetian is free). Walking from Springhill Suites is also an option - we walked several times, but are avid walkers (so this wasn't a problem) - a leisurely walk is about 10 - 15 min to the Strip. The metro train station is across the street by the Hilton - we never used it. Hotel has computers in the lobby to access your email and print boarding passes. Apart from eating breakfast there, we did not sample the food or the bar. It is not an upscale luxury hotel - we knew that - but an incredibly good value, since we did not want to stay right on the strip. Would definitely stay there again and can recommend in best conscience.
reviews.title: Excellent choice for off-Strip accommodation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed one night at the Springhill Suites Las Vegas (by the convention center) after our vacation on the strip. We were looking for a nice room to relax before our flight home and this fit the bill.
reviews.title: Perfect for convention stay, not so convenient for leisure.

reviews.text: The new hotel is lovely. Our king bed room was very comfortable and well designed. The cool blue / greens and Asian-influenced decor came together nicely with a very fresh appearance. The pocket doors to the split bath suited the decor perfectly and were a great space-saving design.
reviews.title: Okay, but not convenient to Strip

reviews.text: I stayed at this property for 4 days at the end of June and found it offered good value for money. My 19th-floor room was clean and spacious, with a comfortable bed and good lighting, and an "office" area with a well-designed desk, comfortable office chair and sofa/coffee table for meetings. The high-speed internet worked well and local phone calls were free. My only complaints are that the single window was streaked with dust from a recent rainstorm and I could hardly see through it (a pity since the view would've been quite good) and that the two little clothes drawers were too small for normal-sized, folded dress shirts. The breakfast buffet was fine but got a bit repetitive on the 4th day. The only fresh fruit offered were apples and bananas, in the middle of the summer. The hotel is right across the street from the Hilton and one block from the Convention Center, where there's a bus stop. There are monorail stops at the Hilton and at the Convention Center; both involve walking about two long blocks in either direction.
reviews.title: Good value for money, convenient to Convention Center

reviews.text: This is a great off the strip hotel. It was less than a year old and it was very clean and modern. The rooms were big and we had plenty of room to spread out. There were essentially 2 separate bathrooms (one with a sink and toilet and one with a sink and shower). I had family with me and having 2 sinks prevented us from bumping into each other. There was a nice flat-panel LCD TV with HD channels and unlike what a previous reviewer stated the internet was fast.
reviews.title: Great Vegas Hotel
Mixed review..
reviews.text: I was surprised that it did not have central A/C. There was only a standard window unit that was too small for that size room. It was on most of the day to keep up with the hot Vegas weather. The fridge and mirocrowave were kinda small and it took a while for the fridge to cool down.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast buffet was free and it had eggs, sausages, cereal, bagels, etc. But it can get kinda old after a couple of days of eating as they don't change it up. Service was good and housekeeping was generous in providing soup/shampoo and extra towels. It was a little far from the main part of the strip, but it was next to the Riviera and Hilton if you wanted to do some gambling.
reviews.title: Not the hotel to choose if easy access to the Strip is what you want

reviews.text: If you want to stay in a quiet, off-the-strip hotel, this is the one to choose. It's new and has plenty of amenties for solo travelers or travelers with family. I recommend it!
reviews.title: wedding in vegas

description: Welcome to SpringHill Suites Las Vegas Convention Center, a new addition to hotels near Las Vegas Convention Center, offering the space you need to vacation or get down to business. This Las Vegas Convention Center hotel’s 4,500 square feet of meeting space is ideal for social or business events. Close to the Las Vegas Strip, our stylish and smartly designed hotel suites are 25 percent larger than comparably priced standard hotel rooms. The hotel is located just minutes from McCarran International Airport (LAS). Enjoy all that Las Vegas has to offer from live shows to shopping at the Fashion Show Mall, touring the Hoover Dam to hiking Red Rock Canyon - you'll find something for everyone. Stop by Palettes Gallery and Bistro for our free happy hour Sunday through Thursday. Enjoy a cocktail or a light meal or relax in your suite and order room service. Great dining is also a short walk or cab ride from our Las Vegas Convention Center hotel. We look forward to welcoming you to our suites in Las Vegas!
